decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall not begin later than three years from the date of the original decision.

Condition : 2 - The development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the proposals contained in the application and the plans submitted therewith (Location Plan (0855-A-00001 Rev P1) received 1st March 2016; Lower Ground Floor Plan (0855-JSA-XX-B1-DR-A-02001 Rev. C1), Ground Floor Plan (0855-JSA-XX-00-DR-A-02001 Rev. C1), Upper Ground Floor Plan (0855-JSA-XX-00A-DR-A-02001 Rev. C1), First Floor Plan (0855-JSA-XX-01-DR-A-02001 Rev. C1), Second Floor Plan (0855-JSA-XX-02-DR-A-02001 Rev. C1), Roof Plan (0855-JSA-XX-03-DR-A-02001 Rev. C1) and North & West Elevations (0855-JSA-XX-XX-DR-A-04001 Rev. C1) received 28th November 2016;  South & East elevations (unnumbered) and Summary of proposed Section 73 changes to Planning Approvals 00886/11/P18 & P19 document received 17th August 2017; Letter from UWL Director of Property dated and received 13th March 2017) and approved by the Local Planning Authority, or as shall have been otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the buildings are occupied.
Condition : 3 - The basement level windows to the western elevation shall be constructed in accordance with the details approved under permission 00886/11/P18 (3,4,7,9,12).
Condition : 4 - The building hereby approved shall be used as student accommodation containing no more than 78 units.

Condition : 5 - Within three months of the date of this permission, a Student Accommodation Travel Plan, compliant with: a) London-wide monitoring methodology (known as TRACE and TRAVL); and b) The Council's 10 Point Guide to Travel Plans, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Thereafter the content of the agreed plan shall be implemented in full unless varied by the prior written approval of the Local Planning Authority.
Condition : 6 - The development shall be carried out in accordance with the Demolition and Construction Management Plan approved under permission 00886/11/P18 (3,4,7,9,12).

Condition : 7 - No demolition or construction works shall take place on site except between 0800 and 1800 hours on Mondays to Fridays and 0900 and 1300 hours on Saturdays. No work shall take place on Sundays or Public Holidays without the prior written approval of the local planning authority.
Condition : 8 - The external materials to be used in the construction of the development shall accord with the details approved under permission 00886/11/P18 (3,4,7,9,12).
Condition : 9 - The development shall be undertaken in accordance with the landscaping details approved under permission 00886/11/P18(10,14).

Condition : 10 - No fans, louvers, ducts or other external plant, other than as shown on the approved plans, shall be installed without the prior written approval of the local planning authority and any such work shall be undertaken in accordance to the approved details.

Condition : 11 - Within three months of the date of this permission, evidence (e.g. photographs, installation contracts and As-Built certificates under the Standard Assessment Procedure/National Calculation Method) shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority to show that the development has been constructed in accordance with the approved Energy Strategy Report.

Condition : 12 - (i). Within three months of the date of this permission, two wheelchair accessible units shall be provided and fitted out to meet the needs of wheelchair users. These units shall be thereafter be permanently retained in this condition. 
(ii). Within three months of the date of this permission, six additional units shall be provided so that they are easily adaptable to the standards in Building Regulations Part M4(3) (Wheelchair User Dwellings) or its subsequent update.

Condition : 13 - The development shall be undertaken in accordance with the Sustainable Urban Drainage strategy approved under permission 00886/11/P18(10,14) and the agreed scheme shall be permanently retained thereafter.

Condition : 14 - Within three months of the date of this permission, details of the following measures must be submitted to and agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority:
(i). Internal monitoring (at service point entries etc.) and a written assessment on foundation design details by a professional person competent to identify the nature and extent of any potential site contamination, to demonstrate that there is no potential vapour ingress; and
(ii). Independent testing of any topsoil/subsoil material brought to the site.
Where requested by the Local Planning Authority upon review of the above information, a scheme for decontaminating the site shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority and the scheme as approved shall be fully implemented and completed within six months of the date of this permission, or as otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.
description: Variation of conditions 2, 5 and 13 to allow changes to the finished floor levels, internal layout and minor elevational alterations of the building permitted under 00886/11/P18 (allowed under APP/F5540/A/13/2197176 dated 26/09/2013) for the demolition of an existing office building and underground parking and the erection of a new part three-storey and part four storey building for student accommodation
